qas.question: Which text was the first to have concepts of astronomy in it?
Who wrote the first 12 chapters of the Siddhanta Shiromani?
In what time period was the Siddhanta Shiromani written?
The second section of the Siddhanta Shiromani has how many chapters?
What topic does the second part of the Siddhanta Shiromani contain?

context: Astronomy: The first textual mention of astronomical concepts comes from <a0_0>the Vedas<a0_0/>, religious literature of India. According to Sarma (2008): "One finds in the Rigveda intelligent speculations about the genesis of the universe from nonexistence, the configuration of the universe, the spherical self-supporting earth, and the year of 360 days divided into 12 equal parts of 30 days each with a periodical intercalary month.". The first 12 chapters of the Siddhanta Shiromani, written by <a1_0>Bhāskara<a1_0/> in the <a2_0>12th century<a2_0/>, cover topics such as: mean longitudes of the planets; true longitudes of the planets; the three problems of diurnal rotation; syzygies; lunar eclipses; solar eclipses; latitudes of the planets; risings and settings; the moon's crescent; conjunctions of the planets with each other; conjunctions of the planets with the fixed stars; and the patas of the sun and moon. The <a3_0>13<a3_0/> chapters of the second part cover <a4_0>the nature of the sphere<a4_0/>, as well as significant astronomical and trigonometric calculations based on it.
